item.description:
Change in the plans - turns out I'll be back from work trip in time to host this on Saturday! So let's steer clear of football games and crazy Gillette Stadium traffic :-) Hope those of you who have RSVP'd will still be able to make it.

And the "easy" refers to the attitude you better bring to this ride. As for the pace of the ride - we'll try to get a sweeper - otherwise we'll adhere to the 'keep-guy/gal-behind-you-in-sight' rule which should keep the group together.

A few of us tried this route one lovely evening this summer, and I ended up taking the group ALL OVER the place except where we needed to be :-) But, it was actually a really nice ride - so let's give it another try!!

A few "warnings" or "considerations," if you will:

  • Patriots are playing at 4:15pm on this day - so take into account the potential for traffic getting to Foxboro
  • This ride is on well-traveled ROADS so be comfortable riding with traffic and riding with a group (know thyself. If you're not comfy with sharing the road with cars, you will NOT enjoy this ride)
  • Bring a relaxed, easy-going spirit and be a good sport...if I got the group lost once, it stands to reason that it'll happen again. But maps will be provided :-)


Because there's ample parking (and beer) here, we'll start near the Walgreens/Waxy O'Connors parking lot (new shopping center on 140 across from Dairy Queen). Look for the bikes - we'll be in the side parking lot closest to the cleaners/Glee gift store/Waxy's/Tanorama stores.

And get this - "grub" doesn't necessarily need to take place at Waxy's. We might try the Chinese place in the plaza. But I'll take an informal poll when we all meet up that day.

MapMyRide.com is having a technical glitch -- so I'm not sure the map is going to come up correctly but if you're interested in the route, click here.

Here are the directions:


  • Head south on 140 onto South Street for 2.3 miles to crossroads (West Street and N. Grove Street)
  • Left for 0.6 mile to end (Rte 106). There's a steep hill at the beginning.
  • Right for 0.1 mile to S. Grove Street on left immediately after the bridge over I-495.
  • Straight for 2.5 miles to Route 152 at traffic light.
  • Straight for 0.4 mile to crossroads (George Street)
  • Right for 0.5 mile to Route 1, at stop sign.
  • Right for 0.4 mile to Shepard Street, which bears right. You'll pass Turnpike Lake on your right.
  • Bear right for 0.4 mile to end (Route 152)
  • Left for 0.4 mile to Mirimichi Street for right.
  • Right for 2.3 miles to end at traffic island. The main road bears right after 0.4 mile and crosses Lake Mirimichi.
  • Left for 0.3 mile to Mill Street on right (sign says TO STATE FOREST).
  • Right for 1.3 miles to fork (Prospect Street, unmarked, bears left).
  • Bear left for 0.8 mile to end (Granite Street, unmarked).
  • Right for 0.9 mile to end (Route 140). You'll pass Sunset Lake on your left.
  • Turn right on Route 140.
item.name: Easy Like SATURDAY AFTERNOON
